title: Supports who 'tax'
body: Is it reportable if your support intentionally takes cs/doesn't let you farm? I see this a lot in low elo. People get autofilled and are bitter over it play a mage and go full ap while clearing waves and denying the adc tons of cs. I even ask them if i can farm, and sometimes they straight up say no and start to troll me by taking all the cs.

replies.body: No, nobody owns the farm. The support can take CS if they want.

that's an extremely stupid idea. Supports are champions that don't rely heavily on gold and more on their peeling abilities. ADCs are one of the most gold reliant champions in the game. To take farm and gold away from an ADC is very detrimental to their gameplay.

> [{quoted}](name=xXrushaXx,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=lXtkEM32,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2018-04-08T16:00:11.740+0000)
>
> that's an extremely stupid idea. Supports are champions that don't rely heavily on gold and more on their peeling abilities. ADCs are one of the most gold reliant champions in the game. To take farm and gold away from an ADC is very detrimental to their gameplay.

I would disagree with you. I have smurfed in low elo (silver/bronze) and i have seen far more supports carry than ADCs. In fact adcs are so bad in low elo they are usually used as bait.

Idk what quality games you're playing in but most ADCs are pretty average. In theory, everyone in a single game should be playing at a similar level. With that in mind, it is more likely that the ADC carries, damage-wise, in comparison to a tank support.

Carrying isn't based on how much damage you do. If you do more damage than anyone else in the match, but still lose - are you still a carry?

Carrying involves playing hard enough to beat out the enemy team, make advantages, and press them /hard/. And that's not something that can be distilled into a statistic.

As A support main which I'm always better than my ADC its always about map awareness that leads to  victory.. if  my ADC goes in too deep while there's no vision why should I follow that lunatic? 
The worst support right now is {{champion:53}}  because any Q your getting off has potential in getting a trade in return off you, but your adc.
Suboptimal play is not against the rules.
Okay, so why don't LCS and high elo supports take all the farm they want? Because it's extremely detrimental to the adc. Idk where you're getting your ideas but they're wrong.

Because there is a difference between high elo and pro play, than in the lower divisions.

You seem to be misunderstanding. Scuttle simply answered your question, "Is it against the rules for supports to take farm." The answer is no, it is NOT against the rules.

Yes, it MIGHT be better on an adc, but it is, again, NOT against the rules for a support to farm.

griefing is a valid report option. Going out of your way to ruin a match for your teammate(s) is griefing.

Will it get you punished? Probably not. Is it right? Just remember how you feel the next time you play something other than support and a teammate walks to your lane or jg and steals half your shit.

I'm not contesting it is griefing Attack Chopper Smurph (I will nto assume your gender xD). In the situation the OP when it is an autofilled person doing it, it can be argued it is griefing. 

However, it is not griefing for me to clear a wave depending on the circumstances. 

"Just remember how you feel the next time you play something other than support and a teammate walks to your lane or jg and steals half your shit." I'm not a good example/target for this. It has happened and I just kind of go "Meh" I'm also the guy who tells support to farm while I back. I play to win, but I try not to let things get to me/upset me.
If the jungler taxes after giving me a kill, that is fine. If my support, which in this case, is toxic and purposely clears waves when I am in lane, that should be very reportable
Your presented case is not one of "The support farms" but more one of "A player didn't get their role and is throwing a fit."

If you are:
1. pushing wave in to reset it for teammate
2. Just last hitting
3. Freezing

that's not stealing cs or anything. That is being a GOOD teammate just soaking xp. Farming while they are IN lane and denying them cs when you aren't proccing relic shield or something... that's different. And THAT is what I"m talking about. Stealing cs on purpose when they are IN lane or farming more than is needed to last hit, reset, or set up a freeze for your teammate is bad. I can't count on all my fingers and toes how many times I've fallen a full level behind due to having to respect the enemy jungler just sitting in bush toplane after my jungler ruined a freeze I'd set up before basing and gave my opponent one. That can easily lead to a full level lead for your opponent and ruin item timings leading to a free lane for a champ that should be getting bullied.  If the laners are about equal in skill and the jungler camps for the guy with a level lead, that can be the entire difference in the game.

That's why you have to THINK about what you are doing. Sometimes clearing out a wave is good (even if your laner is too low elo to realize  it) and sometimes it's best left untouched or minorly trimmed. If you don't know, it's best to leave stuff untouched or to just last hit.
You asked if support CSing was against the rules. I told you the answer.
I asked if support trolling by intentionally taking cs when their adc is in lane because they're mad about something

becuase support items provide a good amount of gold for LCS and their slower then death games.

If the games are slower than death...


Then why didn't death catch you before you saw the end of the game?
*that is NOT a death threat or wish upon you or anyone - merely sarcasm and irony

> [{quoted}](name=xXrushaXx,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=lXtkEM32,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2018-04-08T16:00:11.740+0000)
>
> that's an extremely stupid idea. Supports are champions that don't rely heavily on gold and more on their peeling abilities. ADCs are one of the most gold reliant champions in the game. To take farm and gold away from an ADC is very detrimental to their gameplay.

Alright, as a support main:

there are diffrent sub classes of supports, tank supports and Shield supports.

Tank supports need a good amount of early game gold to get their items (and they build relic shield!)

Shield/protective supports need a UNGODLY amount of gold to get them started and become useful.

Not all adcs rely heavily on gold, someone with high base damage and game sense might give kills to supports to have better peel.

Incomeless supports and feeding everything to the marksmen is certainly META (Most Effective Tactic Available), but the action of not following META is not a punishable offense, even if it may be stupid.

It is META for a reason.
Is that why there are SUPPORT ITEMS that GIVE SUPPORTS GOLD WITHOUT FARMING MINIONS?

Care to explain why laners abused them then?

Plus in a situation where i have a targon stack, my adc isnt very good as a mage support, or if my adc backs and i need to keep the freeze, or after i successfully fed another kill in another lane, you damn well know im taking 1-2 caster creeps, lol.
Is it reportable if your adc takes all of the cannon minions when you have a {{item:3302}} ?

Intentionally taking the cs after they got filled, If they refused to play their support role, then yes that is reportable. 

Otherwise no, because no one owns any gold on the map.

Supports have gold generation items. They don't need farm. They don't scale unless they are a mage support and even then, their power comes from levels. ADCs have the best gold efficiency and item-reliant, they need the farm.
Just because they scale harder with items dosent mean they own the gold though. All that means is that its potentially more benificial to give them the gold.
Support is called support because they support their team. Team-centric. Taking gold is not being team-centric if it's not overall beneficial for your team.

> ...if it's not overall beneficial for your team.

So, it'd be overall beneficial for the team to have the Support stay behind in items, potentially not even having their first? Because, I'm not sure if you've played Support, but most of those items have to be bought piecemeal if you're only using Gold gen. items.

Would I be better off not giving my ADC a powerspike by grabbing _Zeke's Convergence_ for them ASAP? Or should I just hope having _Aegis of the Legion_ and a _Sapphire Crystal_ should be enough?

a 6 item-support vs 1 item ADC. decide which if that's worth.

and no, support item like Zeke's is NOTHING compared to an ADC's 2-3 item powerspike.
If the ADC only has 1 completed item when the support has 6, I don't think the problem is the support.
You're missing the point about support taking the gold because "gold doesn't belong to anybody"

It doesn't belong to anybody. There are cases where it isn't a bad thing for your support to get ahead of the adc. 

AP/mage supports get more damage and harass. Makes it harder for the enemy carry to farm.

Enchanter/healer supports get stronger shield power, cd, and mana regen to keep you in good shape. Can also allow for early redemption to keep alive or Ardent for aome extra bite in trades/sustain.

Guardian/tank supports become beefier. This allows them to try making more plays/going in. Running interference to the carry keep alive from a gank or an early mitigation item, like Knights Vow.

Am i saying the support should farm constantly? No, I am saying it isn't a bad thinf if they get ahead sometimes.
go ahead and downvote, doesn't make me wrong.
If a support can get 6 items and your adc only have 1, even just from passive gold, then that adc is either inting or afk-ing
again, missing the point.
maybe don't make ridiculously exaggerated point so people don't get distracted from the ridiculousness of it?
Or have the IQ to tell the difference of an exaggeration?
ahhh, the personal attack, the last resort of someone who can't have a proper civil discussion
Don't attack first. I punch back.
Learn the difference between attacking the point of discussion and personal attack...

So now you're making personal attacks when you just accused me of doing the same. So much for proper civil disussion, not to mention calling my points ridiculous when you have no point of your own except to argue.

> a 6 item-support vs 1 item ADC. decide which if that's worth.

That's a pretty ridiculous comparison.

> and no, support item like Zeke's is NOTHING compared to an ADC's 2-3 item powerspike.

Then you've not seen good Supports work. Sure, an ADC's 2-3 item powerspike is pretty damn great, but _Zeke's_ **_amplifies_** that spike and makes it more impactful.

But, I can already see you've got it in your mind that Supports should not CS and that the gold would somehow go to waste on them, so, I'mma just leave with a phrase that I've found fits best:

_A good Support **makes** the carry._

Not a ridiculous comparison when it's the other way around. 

Their items multiply with each other, not Zeke's. You can't amplify what they don't have.

If they're doing it purely out of spite because they were autofilled, then yes. It is reportable. It is well-accepted that, during the laning phase, the support avoids taking farm from the declared bot laner. Because the player is doing it, not out of some agreed-upon strategy, but out of intent to "punish" other players on the team, they themselves qualify for punishment by Riot's rules (i.e. Don't be a jerk).

Obviously, there are many caveats to that. A player might accidentally take a few CS, or not realize the AD was in range after returning from base, or as part of a relic shield proc, etc., none of which are punishable by Riot's rules.

stealing a few cs/10 or 20 or 30 is different from intentionally clearing out the wave when your adc specifically tells you not to. A lot of people in low elo want to carry, i get that, but if you're intentionally clearing out waves and denying cs, then complaining about the adc you're in the wrong.
If my adc is shitty at CSing hell yes im going to take CS. why the fuck let it go to waste with the players inability to last hit. Might as well pick up their slack like a support is suppose to.

If they're taking it all and doing so on purpose, then I'd argue yes it's reportable. If they have relic or take a few here and there when they try to land skillshots and poke onto the enemy team, then no. Lastly, if you are performing utterly horribly and they are not, then I'd say give them the farm because they will do more with it. But if you are doing poorly BECAUSE they aren't doing their job to support/protect you or you are doing well, then they should be reported. It's no different than the people who hold champ select hostage because they ARE GOING TO play THAT role and nothing else or the ones who ban any champ you show you want/plan to play because you got their role and wouldn't trade and often also get their duo friend to ban you out too.

That kind of behavior is toxic. It is griefing. It is unacceptable.

The only time I would tax cs as a support is if Im playing a AP carry support which I like to do in low elo AND my adc is really bad AND we are losing lane hard, AND is in no way gonna carry this game, so as a result I step up and start to take CS so I can in turn carry what is upto that point a losing game. Its worked out of me and my team several times.

Supports who tax are not only griefing, they are not being a team player and lowering your team's chance of success because ADCs are item-reliant and therefore need the gold more than any other class. Supports have items that generate gold for them and don't scale. Even if they are playing a mage support, their abilities base damage, range poke and CC is enough to contribute to the team, their damage is in levels mostly, not items.
